intro: Melolobium lampolobum, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and small, trifoliate leaves. Its seed pods are woody and contain several small, smooth seeds. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to survive in dry, nutrient-poor environments.
